ResourceHeader.ResourceName: STEREO-A SWAVES One minute averages of the low (lfr) frequency receiver data.
ResourceHeader.Description: The two STEREO radio receivers measure wave intensity, source direction and angular size in the frequency range 40 kHz to 16 MHz, corresponding to heliocentric source distances of about 1 Rs to 1 AU. One 10-40 kHz receiver measures radio and plasma waves near the 1 AU electron plasma frequency. One receiver makes high time resolution measurements at 50 MHz. Time Domain Samplers make simultaneous wideband waveform measurements on three electric components. Antenna systems include three mutually orthogonal 6-meter monopoles.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: National Aeronautics and Space Administration; Dr. Jean-Louis Henry Bougeret

Parameter.Name: Low Frequency Data
Parameter.Caveats: This is the first 48 values in the daily file. Missing data is indicated by a value less than 0.

Structure.Description: This is the first 48 values in the daily file.

Parameter.Name: Background Value
Parameter.Description: The 48 background value used in (currently) arbitrary decibel (dB) units.
Parameter.Caveats: This is the second 48 values in the daily file. Missing data is indicated by a value less than 0.

Structure.Description: The 48 background value used in (currently) arbitrary decibel (dB) units.

Parameter.Name: Average Intensity
Parameter.Description: The 2-dimensional (# of frequencies X 1440 minutes per day) array of averages in dB above the average (i.e. value-average in dB). Missing data is indicated by a value less than 0.
Parameter.Caveats: This is the next 1440 by 320 values in the daily file. Missing data is indicated by a value less than 0.

Structure.Description: This is the next 1440 by 320 values in the daily file.
